official-title.#text:
To direct the Secretary of Labor to revise regulations
		  concerning the recording and reporting of occupational injuries and illnesses
		  under the Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#text:
Committee on Education and the
			 Workforce

header.#text:
Recording and reporting of
			 occupational injuries and illnesses

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 revise the regulations in part 1904 of title 29, Code of Federal Regulations,
			 concerning the recording and reporting of occupational injuries and illnesses
			 under the

text.#text:
Not later than 180
			 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
,
			 to require site-controlling employers to keep a site log for all recordable
			 injuries and illnesses occurring among all employees on the particular site,
			 whether such employees are employed directly by the site-controlling employer
			 or are employed by contractors or temporary help or employee leasing
			 services.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Occupational Safety and Health Act of 1970

term.#tail:
means the employer that has primary
			 control over the work on a particular work site and supervises the employees on
			 a day-to-day basis on a particular work site.

text.#text: As used in this section, the term
